metadata.topic_title: Ensuring Solutions Are Effective and Relevant

hierarchy.subdomain: Professional Ethics and Codes of Conduct

active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the following: 'Was the SolarWinds supply chain attack preventable through better alignment of cybersecurity solutions with NIST CSF 2.0's Identify (ID) and Govern (GV) functions? Provide evidence from ERM and SCRM perspectives, and link to ethical responsibilities for competence.' Encourage participants to reference voter-suggested examples and critique each other's arguments.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in (ISC)²-aligned topics. Generate 50 high-quality flashcards on 'Ensuring Solutions Are Effective and Relevant' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Professional Ethics and Codes of Conduct > Professional Responsibilities and Duties > Competence and Service Quality > Ensuring Solutions Are Effective and Relevant). Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [INSERT FULL LIST FROM ABOVE] - Active Learning: [INSERT FULL DETAILS FROM ABOVE] - Scaffolding: [INSERT FULL 4 LAYERS FROM ABOVE] - Voter Consensus: Full NIST CSF 2.0 functions completed; ethics links; SolarWinds example; ERM/SCRM ties; Sources: NIST CSF 2.0 (https://doi.org/10.6028/NIST.CSWP.29), (ISC)² Code of Ethics (https://www.isc2.org/ethics). Follow Flashcard Schema exactly: Mix 40% basic Q&A/cloze (Layers 1-2), 40% MCQ application (Layer 3), 20% higher-order MCQ (Layer 4). Use distractor protocol. Ensure progressive difficulty via Bloom's. Output JSON array: [{'front': '...', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'source': '...', 'bloom_level': '...', 'layer': '...'}}]. No extra text.
